title: Halloumi Cheese Fingers Recipe
description: A clever recipe for halloumi. Fry or grill this delicious Cypriot-style cheese and serve it with a Greek salad and crusty bread for a complete meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Cheese Halloumi Cheese Fingers 4.7 (30) 24 Reviews 6 Photos This recipe is a clever way to use halloumi. Fry or grill this Cypriot-style cheese and serve with a Greek salad and crusty bread for a complete meal. Submitted by Linda Updated on November 16, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 10 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings ½ tablespoon olive oil 6 ounces halloumi cheese, cut into 1/2 inch thick sticks 2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice ¼ teaspoon dried oregano black pepper to taste Directions Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add halloumi sticks and cook until the cheese turns light golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Sprinkle with lemon juice, oregano, and pepper to serve. I Made It Print 53 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 299 Calories 25g Fat 3g Carbs 18g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 2 Calories 299 % Daily Value * Total Fat 25g 32% Saturated Fat 13g 66% Cholesterol 64mg 21% Sodium 936mg 41% Total Carbohydrate 3g 1% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 0g Protein 18g 36% Vitamin C 3mg 3% Calcium 6mg 0% Iron 0mg 1% Potassium 16mg 0% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of Halloumi Cheese Fingers 01 of 06 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 06 Photo by  Nakoia Nyx Cox 11/07/2019 delicious 03 of 06 Photo by  Mrs. Imtiaz 12/18/2015 04 of 06 Photo by  Cynthia Ross 04/23/2011 Quick and satisfying. Halloumi cheese has a high melting point, so it's easy to cook and it tastes great with a dash of fresh lemon. I saw Nigella Lawson make a salad with spring mix, grilled halloumi and a soft-boiled egg on TV once. It's really good. I'll upload a picture the next time I'm in the USA. It's worth making. 05 of 06 Photo by  Linda 05/18/2008 1 You’ll Also Love Greek Saganaki 83 Ratings Pickled Cheese 3 Ratings Spicy Baked Feta (Feta Psiti) 50 Ratings Roasted Garlic Tirokafteri 31 Ratings Spicy Feta Dip 8 Ratings Shrimps Saganaki (Greek Recipe) 21 Ratings Tirokafteri (Spicy Greek Feta Dip) 5 Ratings Greek Salad Dip 50 Ratings Baked Brie in Puff Pastry 239 Ratings Sheet Pan Greek Salad Nachos 3 Ratings Greek Feta And Olive Spread 86 Ratings Tiropetes 23 Ratings Baked Brie 349 Ratings Tyrokafteri (Spicy Feta Dip) 2 Ratings Skordalia (Greek Garlic Potato Dip) 5 Ratings Chutney Baked Brie 107 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Linda
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add halloumi sticks and cook until the cheese turns light golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes.;Sprinkle with lemon juice, oregano, and pepper to serve.
